publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1009 Brian Adam: National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004â€”That the Parliament notes that National Science Week takes place between 12 and 21 March 2004; notes that the aims of National Science Week are to celebrate science and its importance to our lives; welcomes the opportunity it gives people from across Scotland to participate in science activities and experiments and to engage in science discussions; congratulates the British Association for the Advancement of Science (BA) for co-ordinating National Science Week which last year attracted hundreds of thousands of people across the UK, and encourages its members to visit the BA website www.the-ba.net/nsw and join in activities in their constituency or region.

S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Fiona Hyslop*, Rob Gibson*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr David Davidson*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Nora Radcliffe*, Fergus Ewing*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Mr John Swinney*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Robert Brown*, Christine Grahame*, Bill Butler*

S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Dr Elaine Murray*, David Mundell*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*
S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-1009 Brian Adam: National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004-That the Parliament notes that National Science Week takes place between 12 and 21 March 2004; notes that the aims of National Science Week are to celebrate science and its importance to our lives; welcomes the opportunity it gives people from across Scotland to participate in science activities and experiments and to engage in science discussions; congratulates the British Association for the Advancement of Science (BA) for co-ordinating National Science Week which last year attracted hundreds of thousands of people across the UK, and encourages its members to visit the BA website www.the-ba.net/nsw and join in activities in their constituency or region. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Rob Gibson, Murdo Fraser, Mr David Davidson, Mike Pringle, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Nora Radcliffe, Fergus Ewing, Mrs Nanette Milne, Mr John Swinney, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robert Brown, Christine Grahame, Bill Butler, Ms Sandra White, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dr Elaine Murray, David Mundell, Richard Lochhead, Mr Jamie Stone, Roseanna Cunningham, Scott Barrie, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Dr Jean Turner
S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Robin Harper*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Shiona Baird*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-1009 National Science Week 12 to 21 March 2004 (lodged on 8 March 2004) Pauline McNeill*
